RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOCO took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure past the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, cleared ALDARIGHTTRICKS leaving the eighth pole and held on well with steady urging. The latter stalked off the rail, challenged toward the three eighths pole and raced close two deep on the far turn, but dropped back past the eighth pole and had to settle for second. TEMPESTIVO broke in the air then settled off the pace, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little more. RUM CUP rounded the first turn about the five path then settled close from the seven eighths pole, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little. LUNAR MISSION saved ground and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole; to no avail. LUNAR GHOST rounded the first turn about the four path, dropped well back from contention and loped around.

ENTRY.NAME: Tempestivo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in the air,chased 3/8,4p far turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE NOVEMBER 22, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 22 Al lowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVER COMPROMISE settled off the rail the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the five path, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final strides. THEWITCHISGONE stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn, dueled to a slim lead passing the sixteenth pole but was outfinished in the final strides. FEARNOUGHT rated close inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and finished well to take third the final yards. MISSIONSNINETYNINE rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and cleared AUBURN MILL approaching the quarter, was met midway on the far turn, remained a close factor through the upper stretch but relented the final sixteenth. The latter became a bit anxious in the gate then stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back toward the quarter, remained close off the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. GOLDEN APPEAL rounded the first turn about the five path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole and entered the far turn near the rail, angled to the five path approaching the head of the lane and showed little further. NIGHT TRAIN WAYNE showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,finished well,up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Never Compromise
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid near 3/8,5p far turn,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STOMPING MOON ducked out and made contact with Irish King leaving the gate then stalked from the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead at the quarter, raced clear nearing the eighth pole and was steadily handled in the stretch. FAST FORWARD rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, gave up the lead at the quarter and ran evenly in the lane. SHARP STYLE exchanged contact with Irish King leaving the gate then saved ground well off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and steadily improved from that point, came through the far turn in the five path and finished evenly to take third past the eighth pole. LET'S EAT saved ground, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little further. Z MYSTIQUE stalked in the three path the first turn, challenged approaching the three eighths pole but dropped back from between horses toward the quarter and faded on the far turn. IRISH KING was jostled leaving the gate, raced in the four path the first turn and stalked into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. DOUBLE MAKER raced in the five path the first turn and gave chase from the three eighths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Forward
ENTRY.OWNER: Shive Charles Clark Patrick and Bright Derrick

ENTRY.NAME: Stomping Moon
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Sun Valley Farm & Spendthrift Stallions, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Sharp Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,bid 3/8,5p far turn,up 3rd past 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Consid ered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LONA LEE chased inside through the backstretch and closed the gap at the rail on the turn, dug in leaving the eighth pole and got up the final yards. NAVY BAND dueled to the lead past the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn at the rail and dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn, but was caught in the final yards. GIRLS PERFUME chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and finished well to take third the final strides. REMY'S HOTSHOT engaged in close early chase, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. MAMA MARGE came away awkwardly then gave chase, rounded the turn in the five path and showed little in the lane. MISS BEE BOP had a brief early lead then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Lona Lee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,closed gap rail turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Navy Band
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Mama Marge
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Contreras Javier

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Octo ber 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUNCAN IDAHO accelerated to the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace, was urged away at the rail on the turn then kept alert in the lane. TEACHINTHERELEASE came away awkwardly then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and finished evenly while settling for second. ADVANCE CASH chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly. LION OF THE SEA gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and flattened the final sixteenth. GOLD FIBER exchanged contact with LOADED SNIPER leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in the four and five paths on the turn and showed little in the lane. The latter exchanged contact with Gold Fiber leaving the gate and dropped well out of it.

ENTRY.NAME: Duncan Idaho
ENTRY.COMMENT: up leaving chute,rated pace,urged away rail turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Loaded Sniper
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and Frock Randy S

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GHOSTLY SQUALL pressured the pace through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then dueled for the lead while lugging in later yards and drew clear nearing the wire. FANCY HER UP dueled for the lead past the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested the rail on the turn and dug in leaving the turn, but was pinched back in later yards and flattened stride from that point. RIVER REWARDS RVF gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly down the lane. PURE NONSENSE saved ground. MY SISTER CLURRIE chased through the backstretch and entered the turn near the rail, angled to the five path toward the eighth pole and ran evenly in the lane. JUBA'S HOUSE chased, rounded the turn about the five path, left the turn outside and showed little in the lane. After a Stewards inquiry and subsequent claims of foul against the rider of Ghostly Squall for interference in later yards, lodged by the owner and rider of Fancy Her Up, the Stewards disqualified Ghostly Squall to second place.

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Her Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: up past 1/2,set pressured pace,rail turn,pinched back later yards

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Ghostly Squall
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,off rail turn,lugged in late,clear near wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since October 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OVERLY CRITICAL rated close off the rail, started a bid leaving the five sixteenths pole and took the nod in the four path approaching the head of the lane, dueled clear nearing mid-stretch and held on well. NEPOTISM saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, eased out past the eighth pole and dug in to take second the final stride. MIND YOUR OWN raced with the pace inside then stalked from the nine sixteenths pole, challenged at even terms at the three eighths pole, remained a close factor nearest the rail on the far turn, flattened stride inside the eighth pole and was nipped from second under the wire. MARTINKELLY raced with the early pace two deep and took the nod at the nine sixteenths pole, was met at the three eighths and contested the edge in the three path on the far turn, but gave up the lead toward the head of the lane and flattened inside the eighth pole. GOLDEN SPOKE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail into the far turn, angled to the five path through the turn and offered little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Spoke
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

ENTRY.NAME: Martinkelly
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 22, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOT N SPICY LOVE settled back inside on the opening turn, started a bid nearing the five sixteenths pole and closed the gap in the three path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up the final yards. FOX RED rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady stretch handling, but was caught in the final yards. MOON OVER MONTANA saved ground racing well back the opening turn, bid leaving the half mile pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and got up for third later yards. MAGNETRON veered out leaving the gate then raced in the three path the first turn, eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the four path, left the turn outside and passed rivals. CLASSY AMERICAN stalked from the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. ONE MORE FACTOR ducked in leaving the gate then rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MAKE WAY was shuffled back at the break, raced in the three path the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. ALWAYS FORGIVEN was pinched at the start and raced well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Fox Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Hot N Spicy Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,bid near 5/16,3p far turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Over Montana
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 1/2,rail far turn,up 3rd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Magnetron
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,3p 1st turn,chased 1/2,4p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: One More Factor
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in break,rated close inside,chased 3/8,rail turn,weakened
